result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Joseph Cadotte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the end of the next business day. 
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing.

Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:32 PM Defendant Daniel Joseph Cadotte appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Daniel Joseph Cadotte.  Cases 21CF236, 21CM82, 21CM129, 21CT39, 21CT40, and 22CF34.  Option 2 in the Offer to Settle per attorney Ryder.  21CM82 CT 1 state moves to dismiss repeater and in 22CF34 as to count 1.  Def waiving right to personal appearance, discussed with attorney.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, willingly, and voluntarily waiving right to appearance and accepts waiver.  State has complied with victim rights.  Def and attorney admits that he is a repeater, with exceptions for 21CM82 and 22CF34.  Def PLEADS NO CONTEST to 21CM82 CT1 NO CONTEST, 21CM129 CT 1 and 2 NO CONTEST, 21CF236 CT 1, 3, 4, and 10 NO CONTEST, 22CF34 CT 1 NO CONTEST, all other charges dismissed and read in.  Each file contains PLQ, reviewed with attorney, understands information and rights giving up, and elements.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied that def is knowingly, willingly, and voluntarily, and accepts NO CONTEST PLEAS.  As a factual basis can the court rely on information in the criminal complaints in each case, parties agree can find factual basis in criminal complaints, court finds factual basis exists, finds GUILTY, direct judgment to enter in cases.   State comments on sentencing.  Attorney comments on sentencing.  See attached Offer to Settle.  Attorney is court appointed, def is not responsible to reimburse for.
